alert.note: Alert for Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 9:57PM CDT until May 19 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Travis. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Austin, Buda, Austin Bergstrom Int Airport, Tanglewood Forest, Rollingwood, Mustang Ridge, Onion Creek, Shady Hollow, Hornsby Bend, Manchaca, Sunset Valley, San Leanna, Creedmoor, McKinney Falls State Park, Pilot Knob, Del Valle, Maha and Garfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
